chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kewon Edward Branch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kewon Edward Branch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kewon Edward Branch.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Court waived appearances. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a resolution date. 
Defense advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 

Defense request a plea date. 

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (12 pages) commencing 08-09-22 by KRISTIN MENZIA.

Defendant Kewon Edward Branch in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Kewon Edward Branch in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Riek. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with M.S.D.
State to submit a written no contact order at the next court date.

Defendant Kewon Edward Branch in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kewon Edward Branch in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
